title: Have a crack at the Mail On Sunday Quiz of the Year
body_text:
Have a crack at the Mail On Sunday's Quiz of the Year: Who called Sir Keir a jellyfish? Did a Tory Minister really say that children prefer sprouts to sweets? And which oh-so-woke, bankrupt council found cash to rename a street Diversity Grove?
- LISTEN: Trump, Zelensky, the rise of Europe’s Far Right and what’s next for NATO – listen to Alas Vine & Hitchens wherever you get your podcasts..
- PODCAST: Michael Gove reveals ‘everything makes me anxious’ during an intimate conversation with his son Will on The Apple & The Tree Listen here
A YEAR IS A VERY LONG TIME IN POLITICS…
1 How did turnips play a role in British politics this year?
a) Because a tabloid newspaper decided to see if Suella Braverman would last longer than the root vegetable, given Liz Truss lost to a lettuce
b) The expenses fraud trial of former Labour MP Jared O'Mara found he had claimed £87.54 for a single turnip
c) Because Minister Therese Coffey responded to a shortage of salad foods by telling people to 'choose turnips' instead
d) The SNP fielded a turnip in the Auchtermuchty South by-election, and it still got more votes than the Conservative candidate
2 What did Michael Gove call Sir Keir Starmer at the Tory conference?
a) A plastic bag, blowing about in the wind until he gets tangled up in something
b) The jellyfish of British politics: transparent, spineless and swept along by the tide
c) The beachside kiosk of British politics: endless flip-flops that fall apart easily
d) A terrible lawyer, as he has no idea what a conviction is
What did Michael Gove call Sir Keir Starmer at the Tory conference?
3 Education Secretary Gillian Keegan said children actually preferred what?
a) Learning about the free market theories of Adam Smith to playing football
b) Portakabins to the classrooms they were turfed out of because of cheap, dangerous concrete
c) Being bullied
d) Sprouts to sweets
4 How did Grant Shapps doctor a photograph in January?
a) Removed Boris Johnson – claiming his staff misheard his comment that the former PM needed 'hair-brushing' as 'airbrushing'
b) To make it look like Sir Keir Starmer was punching a child in the face
c) Turned a graph showing decline in Tory support upside down
d) To place himself on the front line in Ukraine
5 What was the slogan of the Labour Party conference?
a) Tirelessly Delivering Fit-For-Purpose Effectiveness – At Pace
b) Let's Get Britain's Future Back
c) Labour: What's The Worst That Could Happen?
d) Fully Committed To Whatever It Is You Want To Hear
What did Nigel Farage say Coutts used as evidence he was not a fit person to hold an account, in internal documents he obtained?
6 Which of these did Nigel Farage say Coutts used as evidence he was not a fit person to hold an account, in internal documents he obtained?
a) That he kept on making euro withdrawals
b) That he retweeted a Ricky Gervais joke
c) That he stole an unchained pen from their Central London branch
d) That he'd only waste his money on beer and fags
7 Angela Rayner spent £249 of taxpayers' money on what?
a) Elocution lessons
b) A pair of personalised Apple earphones
c) Relationship counselling so she could work with Keir Starmer
d) A street artist to paint 'Tory scum' on the wall of the local Conservative Association
8 Police issued 24 fines after footage emerged of a lockdown-breaking party at Conservative HQ during Covid that was called… what?
a) Jingle And Mingle
b) Get Wrecked And Infect
c) We Will, We Will Pox You
d) Transmission Impossible
9 Why did then Defence Secretary Ben Wallace say: 'I'm not Amazon'?
a) He was pointing out that he paid all his taxes
b) He was denying taking part in the revival of TV's Gladiators under that name
c) In response to criticism that he never delivered his promises
d) In response to Ukrainian leaders' making a wish list for weapons
10 What is the 'grey belt'?
a) A strip of the South Coast occupied by old people
b) Uglier bits of green belt land Sir Keir Starmer says that we should build on
c) The level of karate belt Dominic Raab said he had… though actually it's just a dirty white one
d) Nickname of the implement ex-civil servant Sue Gray uses to whip politicians into line
11 What links the Grand National to George Osborne's wedding?
a) Both were overrun by drunk Scouse women
b) Both were targeted by Just Stop Oil protesters
c) Bookies took more than £250 million in bets on the outcome of both
d) At both, the groom spent the day covered in horse dung
12 Birmingham City Council effectively went bankrupt this year. What of these has it NOT spent money on?
a) Giving new streets 'woke' names, such as Diversity Grove and Equality Road
b) £16 million to move a bus depot just over 300 yards
c) An expensive legal fight to give the Brummie accent legal status, so no one can mock it
d) A cycle lane lasting all of seven feet
CORONATION TREATS… AND OTHER ROYAL SOAP OPERAS
13 How did Penny Mordaunt prepare for her role carrying the Sword of State at the Coronation?
a) Pummelling copies of the European Convention on Human Rights into pulp
b) Press-ups and painkillers
c) Giving Therese Coffey piggy-backs
d) Hard miles rowing the Channel on the lookout for small-boat migrants
14 Which of these artefacts was NOT used in the Coronation?
a) The Armills of Sincerity and Wisdom
b) The Great Golden Spurs, as borne by the 15th Earl of Loudoun
c) The Bejewelled Holy Cufflinks Of Modesty and Penury
d) The Coronation Spoon
How did animated comedy South Park rename Prince Harry's memoir Spare in its savage parody of the Sussexes?
Was Katy Perry at the Coronation?
15 How did animated comedy South Park rename Prince Harry's memoir Spare in its savage parody of the Sussexes?
a) Spare Us
b) Spite
c) Waaagh
d) Frosty The Penis
16 Who was not at the Coronation?
a) Katy Perry
b) Ant & Dec
c) Spice Girl Mel B
d) Danny Dyer
YOU MUST BE WOKING!
17 What euphemistic new name for the obese did Irish researchers suggest in May?
a) 'People with chronic appetite dysregulation'
b) 'Gravitationally advantaged'
c) 'Snack-positive'
d) 'Those who identify as perpetually peckish'
18 Which of these changes was made when Roald Dahl's Charlie And The Chocolate Factory was rewritten to be more politically correct?
a) Oompa Loompas are now gender-neutral
b) Charlie now wins a golden ticket to see the magical organic tofu factory
c) The titles are now attributed to Roald Stew, Dahl being a cultural appropriation of an Indian dish
d) The book ends with Willy Wonka prosecuted for child endangerment, modern slavery, and numerous health and safety breaches
19 Chichester Theatre warned patrons that its production of The Sound Of Music contained… what?
a) 'No non-white people'
b) 'Christian imagery'
c) 'The annexation of Austria'
d) 'Lonely goatherds'
What changes was made when Roald Dahl's Charlie And The Chocolate Factory was rewritten to be more politically correct?
Non-binary singer Sam Smith coined what politically correct phrase on The One Show?
20 Non-binary singer Sam Smith coined what politically correct phrase on The One Show?
a) 'Theybies and gentlethems' instead of ladies and gentlemen
b) 'A fisher-them' rather than 'fisherman'
c) 'Folx' instead of 'folk'
d) 'Rotic' instead of 'romantic', because it doesn't need no man
21 Who or what was renamed amid concerns it might be linked to fossil-fuel emissions?
a) The actor Vin Diesel
b) The band Arcade Fire
c) The Brecon Beacons National Park
d) Burns Night
22 University students were warned that learning about – what – might be 'emotionally challenging'?
a) Gruesome criminology cases
b) Conditions in the First World War trenches
c) Peter Pan
d) The fact they'll probably never be able to afford a house
23 Who said: 'We acknowledge the Anglosupremacy of the sector as part of its coloniality'?
a) The ChatGPT artificial intelligence bot, when asked to come up with the most meaningless woke word salad it could
b) Oxfam, in an 'inclusive' language guide to staff that outlaws phrases such as mother, father and elderly
c) Harry and Meghan announcing that they were entering the podcasting world
d) The head of the Commonwealth Games apologising for speaking English to all-British delegates in London
24 What 'tyranny' provoked social commentator Jordan Peterson to furiously tweet in February, 'Up yours, woke moralists'?
a) Being asked to give his pronouns when ordering a pizza
b) Gender-neutral antiperspirant
c) Being asked not to swear while addressing a kindergarten class
d) Spotting a sign asking people to use as few paper towels as possible in a public toilet
UNLUCKY STARS
25 Who described their actions as 'unwise but not illegal'?
a) Phillip Schofield on his relationship with a young colleague
b) Sam Smith on wearing an inflatable latex outfit to the Brits
c) The MP who claimed a subscription to PornHub on expenses
d) The man who crashed his car into the Downing Street gates
Why was the Barbie film banned in Vietnam?
26 Why was the Barbie film banned in Vietnam?
a) Because pink is a colour reserved only for the ruling family
b) Because officials thought the world map she doodled acknowledged China's controversial territorial claims in the region
c) Because they didn't want 12-year-old children wasting time watching the Hollywood version of the doll when they should be busy making them
d) Because the word 'barbie' means something absolutely filthy in Vietnamese
27 Which of these was NOT in the 2023 catalogue for Gwyneth Paltrow's Goop?
a) A pack of QR codes that play the sounds of 'crystal alchemy singing bowls' infused with gemstones and minerals
b) Combined necklace and sex toy
c) Extension power cord – for £155
d) Hemp-based healing pyramid and aura aligner
28 Which of these was a real film of 2023 about a drug-crazed animal?
a) Cocaine Bear
b) Spice Gull
c) Ketamine Gerbil
d) Ozzy Osbourne: My Life In Rock
29 Who provided the voice for a Ukrainian air raid alert app?
a) Alan Carr, whose laugh was scientifically proven to be the most piercing sound known to man
b) Mark Hamill, in the guise of Luke Skywalker
c) Amol Rajan, since he does everything these days
d) Dame Joanna Lumley, as her dulcet tones would ensure everyone kept calm in a crisis
30 Why did the Archbishop of Canterbury end up in trouble with the police?
a) He got done for speeding
b) His crook was classified as an offensive weapon
c) Flashing (or, as he called it, 'pray and display')
d) Cycling erratically – although he argued if God moves in mysterious ways, so, too, can he
31 Many pop stars had to warn their audiences not to throw things at them on stage this year. Which of these did fans NOT throw?
a) Their mother's ashes at Pink
b) A sex toy at Lil Nas X
c) Chicken nuggets at Harry Styles
d) A Zimmer frame at Cliff Richard
32 What was described as 'an hysterical scream… like King Kong coming out of the jungle'?
a) BBC director-general Tim Davie's reaction to Gary Lineker making another political tweet
b) Gwyneth Paltrow skiing, just before she collided with a retired optometrist
c) Dominic Raab on the warpath against civil servants
d) The noise Nadine Dorries made when she heard her peerage had been vetoed
ABROAD RANGE OF KNOWLEDGE
33 What heightened tensions between China and the US?
a) Joe Biden praising China for giving us Pokémon, manga and the jet ski – all actually Japanese
b) A Chinese balloon, shot down off the coast of South Carolina
c) The dating show Milf Manor, for constantly using 'red flags' as a synonym for bad behaviour
d) The game Chinese Whispers, with Beijing insisting its citizens were at least as good as Westerners at speaking quietly and accurately
Did Joe Biden praising China for giving us Pokémon, manga and the jet ski – which are all actually Japanese - heighten tensions with China and the US?
Was Donald Trump an unusual intruder apprehended at the White House in April?
34 What was unusual about an intruder apprehended at the White House in April?
a) It was a shrew… although Secret Service officers said it could be worse – it could have been a mole
b) It was Donald Trump, who forgot he didn't live there any more
c) It was a two-year-old boy who wriggled through the railings
d) He disguised himself as a statue of Grover Cleveland and stood still every time the camera swung by
35 Why did Paraguay official Arnaldo Chamorro have to resign?
a) For eating a protected pampas fox
b) For signing an agreement with a fictional country
c) For losing vital mineral rights in a poker game
d) For declaring war on Mexico after Taco Bell messed up his food order
36 A fake photo of Pope Francis wearing – what? – went viral
a) A yarmulke
b) A giant white puffer jacket
c) A mankini
d) A T-shirt saying 'I used to be agnostic, now I'm not so sure'
37 Which one of these was a fake sign locals in Majorca put up to stop British tourists hogging prime beach spots?
a) 'Beach water quality maintained by Thames Water'
b) 'Alcohol-free zone'
c) 'Beware of dangerous jellyfish'
d) 'No Brits: Brexit means Brexit'
38 Who said: 'Go giggle elsewhere'?
a) The Swedish Prime Minister, following Britain's lead in banning laughing gas
b) Ridley Scott, throwing people out of the Paris premiere of Napoleon for laughing at all the historical errors
c) An Amsterdam councillor after the city banned smoking cannabis in public
d) Meghan Markle, after reporters guffawed at her story of a high-speed chase through the traffic-clogged streets of New York
39 How did Ivan Dimitrov desecrate a historic wonder?
a) Scratched Ivan + Hayley 23 on the Colosseum
b) Put googly eyes on the Mona Lisa
c) Put a giant Donald Trump 'MAGA' cap on the stone heads of Easter Island
d) Chipped away the 'offensive' genitalia of Michelangelo's David
40 The Dalai Lama had to apologise for what this year?
a) Saying Doctor Who nicked the idea of regenerating from Buddhism
b) Not being a real llama, to the disappointment of children who came to see him
c) Launching a range of merchandise bearing the slogan: 'I can't believe it's not Buddha'
d) Asking a young boy to suck his tongue
Is Argentina's new president Javier Milei nicknamed El Loco - The Madman?
41 Which of these is NOT true of Argentina's new president Javier Milei?
a) He's nicknamed El Loco, or The Madman, and brandished a chainsaw on the campaign trail
b) He gets political advice from his dogs, via a mystic
c) He believes he's the reincarnation of Leon Trotsky and has banned ice-picks from his place so he doesn't die the same way
d) He's a cosplayer with a superhero alter-ego called General AnCap
WE MEAN BUSINESS…
42 What change was Toblerone forced to make to its chocolate in 2023?
a) It had to remove the Matterhorn image from its packaging as it is no longer Swiss enough to use a national symbol
b) Made less pointy under EU directive C-763-093-20B regarding the minimum angles permitted in chocolate production
c) Made its giant bars for airport duty-free stores smaller to avoid excess baggage charges on Ryanair
d) Rebranded as Isosceles Chocolese in New Zealand, after losing a trademark court case to cabaret performer Toby Le Rhone
43 What is The Minger?
a) An Alton Towers ride that got stuck, leaving riders upside-down for three hours
b) Britain's smelliest cheese, newly available in Asda
c) One of the less popular characters in The Masked Singer
d) The name Menzies Campbell now goes by in his cage-fighting career
44 What does a company called Colossal want to bring back from the dead?
a) Woolworths
b) The dodo
c) The mullet hairstyle
d) Lilt
45 What was unexpectedly found in a Cumbria Wetherspoons?
a) A decent pint
b) Ancient Egyptian drinking vessels lost by the British Museum
c) Secret nuclear submarine plans
d) Nadhim Zahawi's tax receipts
A SPORTING CHANCE
46 Who was called in to help VAR decisions?
a) An optician
b) Pilots, to explain the importance of clear communication
c) A video VAR assistant referee or VVARAR. If that doesn't work they'll add another one, the VVVARARAR
d) An anger-management specialist to quell crowd fury at the verdicts
47 An essential part of the technical equipment dealing with potential rain at Wimbledon is what?
a) A chart of previous rainfall, dubbed the Steffi Graph
b) A toy duck nicknamed John QuackEnroe
c) A powerful fan to remove rainwater, the Maria Shower-blower
d) A navigation aid nicknamed the Martina SatNavRatilova
48 What caused a 20-bike pile-up during the Tour De France?
a) A parrot flew into a rider's face
b) Cyclists got drunk when someone spiked their water with pastis
c) A fan trying to take a selfie got into the path of the race
d) Protesting farmers covering part of the route in slippery sheep's blood
49 What is Bazball?
a) An enthusiastic style of play adopted by England's cricket team
b) London's new high-fashion charity extravaganza set to rival New York's Met Ball, thrown in honour of Barry Chuckle.
c) A detergent dispenser you put in with your washing
d) The only new game show launched this year not hosted by Bradley Walsh… 'That's Bazball!'
50 Who was the year's most unlikely sporting champion?
a) Neil Rutter, who beat 149 rivals to win the World Bog Snorkelling Championship in August
b) Carmella Contralto, who hurled her iPhone 375ft at Cardi B on stage, rendering the rap artist temporarily unable to perform
c) Ice water swimming supremo Finbar Frost, who celebrated his January win by dipping himself into a large gin and tonic
d) Harry and Meghan, whose sprint to get in front of the cameras at the Invictus Games set an all-time record
Most watched News videos
- Extraordinary moment mass brawl breaks out between Brits on flight
- Finance expert's TV interview interrupted by adorable granddaughter
- Moment driver veers to target e-bike riders before killing teen
- Moment Swiss bar fire owners collapse after being confronted
- Chilling police interview of ISIS fanatic plotting UK attack
- Astonishing moment a street is swallowed by a sinkhole
- Israeli hostage reveals how she survived being tortured
- Deepak Chopra confronted over his relationship to Epstein
- Food vlogger dies after 'eating toxic devil crab'
- Spy cam shows woman on her knees next to Jeffrey Epstein
- New video shows man with backpack similar to Guthrie kidnapper
- Toddler opens car door in traffic and sends biker flying
